intro: Galium verum lusus hispidulum, commonly known as yellow bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit and features small, yellowish flowers clustered in cymes. The plant has slender, hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers bloom in early summer, attracting various pollinators like bees and flies.
